_note: These pages are notes from the book Concepts of Programming Languages by  Robert W. Sebesta 10th edition
Orthogonality: A small set of objects can be combined in a small number of ways to get the desired result (Simplicity).
Aliasing: Having two or more distinct names that can be used to access the same memory cell.

von Neumann architecture.Definition: The architecture used on modern computers where both data and programs are stored in the same memory and CPU is separate from the memory.

Fetch-execute cycle.Definition: The process of execution of a machine code program on a von Neumann architecture
Steps: fetch the instruction pointed to by the program counter
increment the program counter to point at the next instruction

Linking: Takes one or more object files generated by a compiler and combines them into a single executable file
